verses.roman:
naivākṣa-kovidā yūyaṁ
gopālā vana-gocarāḥ
akṣair dīvyanti rājāno
bāṇaiś ca na bhavādṛśāḥ

synonyms: na—not; eva—indeed; akṣa—in playing at dice; kovidāḥ—expert; yūyam—You; gopālāḥ—cowherds; vana—in the forest; gocarāḥ—ranging about; akṣaiḥ—with dice; dīvyanti—play; rājānaḥ—kings; bāṇaiḥ—with arrows; ca—and; na—not; bhavādṛśāḥ—the likes of You.
translation: [Rukmī said:] You cowherds who wander about the forests know nothing about dice. Playing with dice and sporting with arrows are only for kings, not for the likes of You.
